etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in Giles Fletcher. From (i) Middle French, French pérégrinité strange or foreign thing, foreignness

definitions: Foreignness in style, fashion, dialect, etc.; strangeness, outlandishness.

notes.text: Considered to be a foreign word by Johnson.

definitions: The condition or quality of being a foreigner or (resident) alien; (Roman Law) the condition of being a peregrine.
